text: Lewis "Lew" Wallace (April 10, 1827February 15, 1905) was an American lawyer, Union general in the American Civil War, territorial governor and statesman, politician, and author. He is remembered today for his historical novel Ben- Hur: A Tale of the Christ (1880). This book has been a bestseller since its publication. It has been called "the most influential Christian book of the nineteenth century.""Ben-Hur: The Book That Shook the World" , Humanities, November/December 2009 Volume 30, Number 6, Accessed 2010-04-20 The story has been adapted four times for the movies. ==References== Category:Lawyers from Indiana Category:Writers from Indiana Category:1827 births Category:1905 deaths Category:Military people from Indiana Category:Lawyers from New Mexico Category:Writers from New Mexico
